intelligence_grade_justification: Strong data on offerings, pricing, positioning, and company size. Social media data is partial (Instagram confirmed, Facebook not fetchable). CELTA/DELTA pricing not indexed. Google Maps rating not captured. Grade would be A with manual browser verification of remaining gaps.

company_profile.note_founding: Founded 1953 as language school; became first IHWO affiliate in former Soviet Union in 1989
company_profile.location_note: Central location, easy access to all public transport

general_english_adults.levels: All levels — placement via online written test + in-person speaking assessment, mapped to CEFR (A1-C2) and IH internal levels

intensive.note: Higher contact hours, specific schedule not indexed

ielts.note: 6-week intensive course with pre-course test and interview

business_english.corporate_note: Corporate classes within same department can be larger than 4-8

one_to_two.note: Per student pricing not specified — may be per pair

adults_5_week.schedule: Daily except weekends, 1.5 hours per session

adults_5_week_alt.note: Alternative pricing found — may be current vs previous year

celta.description: Cambridge Certificate in English Language Teaching to Adults
celta.price_usd_estimated: 1500-2000 (estimated based on global CELTA pricing adjusted for Georgia cost of living)

delta_module_1.description: Diploma in English Language Teaching to Adults — Module 1 (written exam)
delta_module_1.duration: Extensive course starting November, exam in June

other_certificates: IH Certificate in Teaching Young Learners (IHCYLT)

english_for_specific_purposes.note: ESP courses listed as a menu item on website — details not indexed

general_english_group_monthly_3x.confidence: high — indexed from fees page via site: search

celta_course.confidence: low — estimated from global benchmarks, not verified

pricing_intelligence.pricing_model: Monthly subscription by frequency — not per-hour. Students commit to a frequency (1x/2x/3x per week) and pay monthly. This model encourages retention.
pricing_intelligence.payment_terms: Monthly — no evidence of term-based bulk discounts or upfront payment incentives found

instagram.assessment: Weak for a market leader. 697 followers is very low for the largest English school in Georgia. Suggests social media is not a primary acquisition channel.

facebook.note: Facebook page confirmed to exist but could not be fetched. Given Facebook's dominance in Georgia, this is likely their strongest social channel.

twitter.note: Account exists on X/Twitter — engagement likely minimal in Georgia market

social_media_intelligence.social_media_assessment: Digital presence appears under-invested for a 35-year market leader. Instagram is neglected (697 followers, 149 posts over years). This suggests the school relies on brand legacy, word-of-mouth, and institutional reputation rather than digital marketing. This is a strategic vulnerability — a digitally savvy competitor could capture attention-driven market share.

sample_quotes: I will advise all my friends to take their Celta in IH (Tbilisi). It was very challenging and unforgettable experience.
An extremely useful course run by highly qualified professionals who respond to trainees' needs with great concern and responsibility.
A brilliant course with super professional tutors!
All the materials are provided, well-equipped classrooms, good environment for doing CELTA course.

yell_ge.note: Listed on Georgian Yellow Pages but no reviews

google_maps.note: Not captured — would require direct Google Maps access

reviews_intelligence.review_assessment: Reviews are very positive but concentrated on CELTA (teacher training) rather than general English courses. The 25 reviews on EducationRating and CELTA-specific reviews paint a picture of high instructional quality. However, there is a gap: no visible reviews from general English adult students. This could mean either (a) general English students don't review, or (b) CELTA is the reputation-driving product.

target_segments: Young professionals (22-35) seeking career advancement through English proficiency
University-bound students needing exam prep (IELTS, TOEFL, Cambridge)
Aspiring English teachers seeking CELTA/DELTA certification
Corporate clients needing Business English for teams
Parents investing in children's English education (ages 7-17)
value_propositions: Only Cambridge Authorised Assessment Centre in Georgia
35+ year track record (since 1989 as IHWO affiliate)
Only CELTA and DELTA provider in the country
Comprehensive level system aligned to CEFR
positioning.brand_positioning: Premium institutional — 'the gold standard' for English in Georgia
positioning.marketing_sophistication: 5/10 — Strong brand legacy but weak digital execution. Website is functional but not conversion-optimized. Social media is neglected. Relies on institutional reputation over active marketing.

weaknesses: No student testimonials on main pages
No live chat or instant inquiry

steps: 2. Schedule in-person or phone Speaking Assessment
5. Visit school to register or register online
enrollment_process.friction_assessment: Medium friction — two-step assessment before enrollment. This is standard for quality language schools but creates a barrier vs competitors who offer instant sign-up or trial lessons.

strengths: Only Cambridge exam centre in Georgia — massive competitive moat; no competitor can offer Cambridge-accredited exams
35+ year brand legacy — deep trust in the Georgian market
Only CELTA/DELTA provider — monopoly on teacher training; feeds teacher supply pipeline
Part of IHWO global network — access to methodology, materials, and brand halo
15 classrooms + full facilities — physical infrastructure advantage
Comprehensive product range — from age 7 to DELTA, General to Business to Exam Prep
Dual delivery (in-person + Zoom) — flexibility without being online-only
Monthly pricing model — lower perceived commitment than term fees
weaknesses: Social media presence is surprisingly weak for market leader (697 Instagram followers)
Website lacks modern conversion features (no booking system, no chat, no student stories)
Pricing transparency requires navigation — no single clear pricing page
No visible online-only product line — misses remote-first learners
Reviews are concentrated on CELTA, not general English — reputation is lopsided
Revenue under $5M — limited budget for marketing innovation
11-50 employees suggests lean operation — capacity constraints possible
strategic_vulnerabilities: Digital marketing gap — a competitor with strong Instagram/Facebook/TikTok presence could capture younger demographics
No trial lesson offering — competitors like SpeakUp offer 40 GEL trial lessons which lower acquisition barriers
B2B corporate segment seems underdeveloped — 4-8 person group size limit vs dedicated corporate training providers
No subscription/unlimited model — the 'Netflix of English' model could disrupt their per-frequency pricing
CELTA monopoly could be disrupted if another provider gets Cambridge authorization
Price point is mid-premium — budget-conscious learners go to platforms like Preply (9-22 USD/hr) which undercuts them significantly
Content marketing is absent — no blog, no YouTube, no podcasts — missing organic discovery channel

primary_persona.name: Career-Advancing Professional
primary_persona.motivation: Needs English for international company job, promotion, or study abroad application
primary_persona.willingness_to_pay: 300-500 GEL/month — views it as career investment
primary_persona.media_consumption: Facebook primary, Instagram secondary, Google search for research

secondary_persona.name: Exam-Focused Student
secondary_persona.motivation: Needs IELTS/TOEFL score for university admission abroad

tertiary_persona.name: Aspiring English Teacher
tertiary_persona.note: Captive audience — no local alternative for CELTA
